classification.description: This compound belongs to the class of inorganic compounds known as alkali metal permanganates. These are inorganic compounds in which the largest oxoanion is permanganate, and in which the heaviest atom not in an oxoanion is an alkali metal.

category.category: Compounds used in a research, industrial, or household setting

drug-interaction.name: Ramipril
drug-interaction.description: The risk or severity of hyperkalemia can be increased when Potassium permanganate is combined with Ramipril.
